result.execSummary:
The defendant Clayton A Curry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DE will be allowed to transfer probation to the State of Texas to run concurrent with sentencing DE is currently serving.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

DE will provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

DE will pay the Domestic Abuse surcharge of $100.00

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clayton A Curry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case settlement

Defendant Clayton A Curry in court telephonic with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites case settlement into the court record. Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  Ct's 2,3 will be DRI.  DE will enter a plea of G to Ct 1.  Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties,  will order sentence withheld, one year probation, CC, DNA sample and surcharge.  DE will be allowed to transfer probation to the State of Texas, probation will be concurrent to Texas probation.  DE will pay the DOM surcharge. DE to contact the DOC in Ladysmith to make arrangements for probation.
Sentencing hearing on March 15, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court telephonic.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties will do a scheduling conference on this tommorow with the JA.  DE just released from custody, has not had contact with him for scheduling yet.
Sentencing hearing on February 28, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE incarcerated per letter he wrote to the court.  DE would like hearing adjourned until February.  Adjourn to 2/18/17 @ 3:30PM.  DE may appear telephonic, with no objection by the State  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 28, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Dated 1/20/17 from JA S Lee with attached letter written by DE to the court
Sentencing hearing on January 24, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Clayton A Curry in court telephonic with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  Sentencing will be via/telephonic appearance.  Set for sentencing 1-24-17 @ 1:00PM.  DE currently resides in Texas and has a travel restriction on his bond from the State of Texas.

DE at COCC window @ 8:00AM for his scheduled court today.  Hearing had been rescheduled but DE stated he did not get notice of that, gave DE a copy of the new NOH for hearing scheduled 4/12/16.
